text.__SUMMARY__: Letheobia wittei, also known as De Witte's gracile blind snake or Witte's beaked snake, is a species of snake in the family Typhlopidae. The species is endemic to Africa.
text.Etymology: The specific name, wittei, is in honor of Belgian herpetologist Gaston-François de Witte.
text.Further reading: Roux-Estève, Rolande (1974). "Révision systématique des Typhlopidae d'Afrique. Reptilia. Serpentes ". Mémoires du Muséum national d'histoire naturelle, Paris, Séries A, 87: 1–313. (Rhinotyphlops wittei, new species, p. 239). (in French).
